solution_line_template: Four times the number of problems Martha answered is {multiplier} x {martha_finished} = <<{multiplier}*{martha_finished}={martha_times_four}>>{martha_times_four}.
The number of problems Mark answered is {jenna_finished} / {mark_divisor} = <<{jenna_finished}/{mark_divisor}={mark_finished}>>{mark_finished}.

The total number of problems Martha, Jenna, and Mark answered is {martha_finished} + {jenna_finished} + {mark_finished} = <<{martha_finished}+{jenna_finished}+{mark_finished}={total_friends_finished}>>{total_friends_finished}.
So, this means Angela was able to answer {total_problems} - {total_friends_finished} = <<{total_problems}-{total_friends_finished}={angela_only_finished}>>{angela_only_finished} problems.
